channel.title: Client display of exact combat level
channel.description:
I've been trying to figure this out, but i've decided i suck...I just want to round ourplayer.level to 2 decimal places but i cannot seem to be able to do calculations and i'm pretty shitty with java...any help would be appreciated.
i know i need to establish a float and double value then use math.round BUT i can't figure it out i'm too new at this...

item.title: Client display of exact combat level
item.dc:creator: @Spyke8x Spyke8x
item.description:
@Spyke8x wrote:

thanks very much. I can probably get it working now. =D

item.title: Client display of exact combat level
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

The problem here is that the math.round function only rounds to the nerest integer. The eaisest way is to round to two decimal places is to use java’s DecimalFormat class (java.text.DecimalFormat). You can even make your own function that will round the value, for example:


public double round2twodec(double dub) {
        	java.text.DecimalFormat decFormat = new java.text.DecimalFormat("#.##");
		return Double.valueOf(decFormat.format(dub));
}

Now simply use round2twodec(double value you want to round) and it will round the number you want to two decimal places.

You can even make that method better by adding a string so you can define how much decimal places you want.

Read full topic
item.source: Client display of exact combat level
